newsitem.title: USA: Agreement on IMF's GAB finalized - French sources.
newsitem.headline: Agreement on IMF's GAB finalized - French sources.

text.p: The Group of Ten has finalized an agreement for doubling International Monetary Fund emergency resources -- the General Arrangements to Borrow, French sources said on Sunday.
They said a new group, including countries contributing to IMF emergency funds for the first time, would meet at least once a year to supervise the "New Arrangements to Borrow."
The group, which would also include G-10 members, would have a rotating presidency.
The Group of Ten in a statement earlier on Sunday welcomed progress made in doubling the IMF's emergency funds and recommended that the process be brought to a rapid conclusion.
The wording of the statement appeared to suggest that the final agreement had not yet been reached.

The sources said that under the agreement, around a dozen new countries would bring fresh resources to the New Arrangements to Borrow, doubling the $25 billion in emergency funds currently available under the General Arrangements to Borrow, to which G-10 countries contribute.
The emergency funds are used by the IMF to help countries facing serious financial crises such as the one which hit Mexico in late 1994.
